body:
"transposition" of outputs does not make sense. How about this:

Mostly equivalent to numpy.linalg.svd, except that order of output arguments here is `s`, `u`, `v` when `compute_uv` is `True`, as opposed to `u`, `s`, `v` for numpy.linalg.svd. Also notice that this function returns `v` as opposed to `transpose(conj(v))`  for numpy.linalg.svd, which does not follow the mathematical definition of the SVD.
body_html:
"transposition" of outputs does not make sense. How about this:

Mostly equivalent to numpy.linalg.svd, except that order of output arguments here is s, u, v when compute_uv is True, as opposed to u, s, v for numpy.linalg.svd. Also notice that this function returns v as opposed to transpose(conj(v)) for numpy.linalg.svd, which does not follow the mathematical definition of the SVD.
body_text:
"transposition" of outputs does not make sense. How about this:
Mostly equivalent to numpy.linalg.svd, except that order of output arguments here is s, u, v when compute_uv is True, as opposed to u, s, v for numpy.linalg.svd. Also notice that this function returns v as opposed to transpose(conj(v))  for numpy.linalg.svd, which does not follow the mathematical definition of the SVD.
